alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 7:24PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Eagle County through 800 PM MDT... At 723 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Radium, or near State Bridge. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Eagle County, including the following locations... Mc Coy, Bond and State Bridge. This includes Colorado 131 between mile markers 4 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys
